item.title: Tom add a quote by Joseph Conrad
item.description: "My task, which I am trying to achieve is, by the power of the written word, to make you hear, to make you feel--it is, before all, to make you see." -- Joseph Conrad

item.title: Tom add a quote by Vivian Mercier
item.description: "[Waiting for Godot] has achieved a theoretical impossibilityâ€”a play in which nothing happens, that yet keeps audiences glued to their seats. What's more, since the second act is a subtly different reprise of the first, he has written a play in which nothing happens, twice." -- Vivian Mercier

item.title: Tom add a quote by e.e. cummings
item.description: "To be nobody but yourself in a world which is doing its best day and night to make you like everybody else means to fight the hardest battle which any human being can fight and never stop fighting." -- e.e. cummings

item.title: Tom add a quote by E. E. Cummings
item.description: "I'm living so far beyond my income that we may almost be said to be living apart." -- E. E. Cummings

item.title: Tom add a quote by Geoffrey Chaucer
item.description: "The lyf so short, the craft so long to lerne." -- Geoffrey Chaucer

item.title: Tom add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "Genuine poetry can communicate before it is understood." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Tom add a quote by Richard Hugo
item.description: "Never has your Buick / found this forward a gear." -- Richard Hugo
